messages.content:
### FAQ: High‑Resolution Rendering on older X200 hardware
**Q:** Why is the High‑Resolution Rendering feature disabled on my older X200 laptop?
**A:** The feature requires a graphics processor with at least 2 GB of dedicated VRAM and driver version 450.0 or newer. Older X200 models ship with integrated graphics that do not meet this VRAM requirement, so the system automatically disables High‑Resolution Rendering to prevent performance problems. You can still use the standard rendering mode or upgrade to a supported GPU.
